title: Chelsea Handler shares a VERY cheeky snap to Instagram
text:
It's been a decade since she posed for her non-nude Playboy pictorial.

But on Wednesday, Chelsea Handler went one better, when the comedienne posted a very cheeky snap of herself to Instagram.

In the photo, the 44-year-old wrapped a towel around her shoulders, leaving her pert derriere exposed.

Sun's out buns out: On Wednesday, Chelsea Handler posted a very cheeky snap of herself to Instagram

The host of Chelsea lately stood, backside exposed, as she stared out a set of glass doors at the scenery of Australia's Hobart, Tasmania.

Her trademark blonde tresses were pulled up in a high, loose bun.

The host of Netflix special Hello, Privilege. It's Me, Chelsea captioned the post, 'I can’t believe I’m single.'

The risque picture comes just days after Chelsea posted a snap in which she exposed her breasts while standing next to an elderly crossing street sign.

Her nipples were tactfully covered by images of oranges.

She's got some front! The risque picture comes just days after Chelsea, 44, posted a snap in which she exposed her breasts while standing next to an elderly crossing street sign

Last month, Handler revealed that while filming her Netflix documentary, the streaming giant forced her to take sexual harassment training after she slapped a woman's butt on the first day of shooting.

The former late-night talk show host said after day one of filming her new documentary Hello Privilege. It's Me, Chelsea, she attended an open mic beatnik night at the University of Southern California where she was so impressed with a black singer, she hugged her and 'smacked' her butt.

But what the Chelsea thought was a sign of affection, turned into a very big lesson on personal boundaries.

Whoops! Last month, Handler revealed that while filming her Netflix documentary, the streaming giant forced her to take sexual harassment training after she slapped a woman's butt on the first day of shooting

'I had to take sexual harassment training from Netflix right out of the gate,' Handler said on Jimmy Kimmel Live.

'This black woman sang this great song, and I was sitting behind her. When she got up, I gave her a hug to say great job, and kind of smacked her on the butt,' Handler explained. 'That’s my sign of affection … It’s not a sexual affront because I’m straight — or so I thought.'

The following day Netflix called the comedian to say the woman was very offended by Handler's smack and she'd be forced to attend sexual harassment training.
